recipes.name: Bruschetta with Tomato and Basil (Bruschetta al Pomodoro e Basilico)
steps: Preheat the oven to 200°C (400°F).
Brush baguette slices with olive oil and toast in the oven until golden.
In a bowl, mix diced tomatoes, chopped basil, minced garlic, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Spoon the tomato mixture onto the toasted baguette slices.
Serve immediately.
author: Marco Mamprin
notes: A classic Italian appetizer that's simple and delicious.
wine: Pair with a light Pinot Grigio.
nutritional_infos: Calories: 120 per serving, Protein: 2g, Fat: 5g, Carbs: 15g

recipes.name: Caprese Skewers (Spiedini Caprese)
steps: Thread cherry tomatoes, mozzarella balls, and basil leaves onto skewers.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.
author: Marco Mamprin
nutritional_infos: Calories: 90 per skewer, Protein: 5g, Fat: 6g, Carbs: 3g

recipes.name: Salmon Pastry Shell (Guscio al Salmone)
steps: Work the flour with 150 g of softened, diced butter, a pinch of salt, and 2 tablespoons of water to form a dough. Knead until smooth and let rest for 30 minutes.
Clean the salmon by removing skin and bones, then cut it into small cubes.
Sauté the salmon in olive oil and white wine for 5 minutes, season with salt and pepper, then let it cool.
In a bowl, mix the salmon with the egg, cream, chopped chives, and ground coriander.
Add peeled and deveined shrimp to the mixture and stir well.
Grease a pie dish with the remaining 20 g of butter and line it with the prepared dough.
Fill the crust with the seafood mixture and bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for 40 minutes.
Serve hot.
author: Marco Mamprin
notes: A savory seafood pastry perfect for special occasions.
wine: Pair with a dry white wine like Sauvignon Blanc.
nutritional_infos: Calories: 350 per serving, Protein: 20g, Fat: 18g, Carbs: 25g

recipes.name: Spicy Tuna Fish Cakes
ingredients: 1 small piece of fresh ginger, grated
A handful of fresh coriander, chopped
A handful of fresh coriander, chopped [sauce]
steps: In a large bowl, mix the tuna, chopped water chestnuts, grated ginger, spring onions, coriander, chili, and kaffir lime leaves.
Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce.
Beat the two eggs in a separate bowl, then add them to the mixture and mix well until it holds together.
Shape the mixture into small, flat cakes.
Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat.
Fry the fish cakes for 2–3 minutes on each side, until golden and crispy.
In a small bowl, mix sugar, fish sauce, rice wine vinegar, lemon juice, and chopped coriander until the sugar dissolves.
Serve the fish cakes hot with the dipping sauce on the side.
author: Gordon Ramsay
notes: Crispy, flavorful fish cakes with a tangy dipping sauce.
wine: Pair with a dry Riesling or crisp white wine.
nutritional_infos: Calories: ~180 per cake (approx.), Protein: 15g, Fat: 10g, Carbs: 6g
